quote: Our goal is to search within a large space of machine learning primitives and parameters, which together constitute a pipeline, for solving a task on a given dataset.
Automatic machine learning is an important problem in the forefront of machine learning.
Using a grammar decreases the branching factor and average depth of the MCTS.
Our system uses model-based reinforcement learning, combining a neural network with MCTS, and the search is constrained by a pipeline grammar.
Using the pipeline grammar is on average between two and three times as fast than without using the grammar.
Our results demonstrate competitive performance while being an order of magnitude faster than existing state-of-the-art AutoML methods.
